ISSUE.TITLE: Consider removing console.write from unit tests.
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: In the schema tests ``` namespace Nop.Data.Tests { [TestFixture] public class SchemaTests { [Test] public void Can_generate_schema() { Database.SetInitializer<NopObjectContext>(null); var ctx = new NopObjectContext("Test"); string result = ctx.CreateDatabaseScript(); result.ShouldNotBeNull(); Console.Write(result); } } } ``` we are writing out the result, which in this case ends up writing a lot of SQL statements to the console, which get captured in any type of build logs. Is this a needed statement?

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #1293 from agametov/develop fix bugs and micro refactoring
